summary.para: Notifies the object to register its worker threads with the Multimedia Class Scheduler Service (MMCSS).

param.name: pdwTaskIndex
param.para: The MMCSS task identifier. If the value is zero on input, the object should create a new MCCSS task group. See Remarks.

param.name: wszClassName
param.para: The name of the MMCSS task.

param.name: lBasePriority
param.para: The base priority of the thread.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the object does not create worker threads, the method should simply return S_OK and take no further action.
Otherwise, if the value of *pdwTaskIndex is zero on input, the object should perform the following steps:

item.description: A single worker thread calls to create a new MMCSS task identifier. Store this value.
Any additional worker threads call using the new task identifier.
Return the new task identifier to the caller, by setting *pdwTaskIndex equal to the task identifier.

remarks.para: If the value of *pdwTaskIndex is nonzero on input, the parameter contains an existing MMCSS task identifier. In that case, all worker threads of the object should register themselves for that task by calling .

summary.para: Specifies the work queue that this object should use for asynchronous work items.

param.name: lWorkItemBasePriority
param.para: The base priority for work items.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The object should use the values of dwMultithreadedWorkQueueId and lWorkItemBasePriority when it queues new work items. Use the or function to queue the work item.
